result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

4:01 pm PM Defendant John R Phelan in court.  Attorney Amanda K. Riek in court for John R Phelan.  Attorney Jordan Lippert in court for State of Wisconsin. Regarding the scope of DNR authority; warden had authority to do what he did.  Probable cause does not require officer determine what drug was involved.  Court denied motion to suppress.  Atty Riek requested jury trial be scheduled.  Status conference 4-6-22 @ 8:30 am for scheduling.  Atty Riek motioned signature felony bond be amended to allow out of state travel.  Court modified bond to remove travel restriction.

1:50 PM Attorney Kevin R. Calkins appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant John R Phelan appeared by phone, Attorney Amanda K. Riek appeared by video for the defendant.  Statement by Attorney Riek; request to convert current cash bond to a signature bond. State does not oppose. Court granted, $1,000.00 cash bond converted to a $1,000.00 signature bond; posted bond to be returned to poster.  Discussion/statement by Atty Riek re: motion to suppress/brief & State's motion to reopen.  Attorney Calkins took no position; will refer to Attorney Long.  Per Court, matter will be reset. 2:03 PM

01:50 PM Defendant John R Phelan by video, in custody with attorney Ronald Benavides.  Sheila M. Smith appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant quashed. Atty Benavides requested to withdraw as counsel. State had no objection to the request. Bond argument. Atty Benavides will need to file a new motion to withdraw and and order. Defendant would like another chance to talk to Atty Benavides. $1000.00 cash bond, in addition to any previously posted bond. All prior conditions remain. Atty Benavides to inform the Court by close of Friday if staying on the case. 2:00  PM
